title: [Large-scale] MakerSpace-Based Science Inquiry Project: Integrated Language Learning Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic scientific principles, ability to use simple digital tools, and English or foreign language reading proficiency
context.additional_context: Designing makerspace activities using smartphones, offering convergent education combining language learning and scientific inquiry.

learning_goals: Students design one science experiment model using smartphone-based makerspace tools (Tinkercad, Fusion 360), implement it via 3D printing or virtual simulation, and achieve ≥4 points (out of 5) in each of three peer evaluation rubric items (functionality, creativity, accuracy).

During a one-week intensive course, learners select three scientific concepts (thermodynamics laws, molecular structure, experimental error analysis) in English, write a 150-word report or 1-minute 40-second presentation per concept, and meet peer evaluation standards (clarity ≥70%, grammar accuracy ≥80%) and instructor feedback (rubric score ≥8/10).
Students enhance scientific inquiry processes and creative design skills through team-based problem-solving activities.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
